name: (3beta,4alpha,8alpha,17xi,20xi)-4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1934
Reason: 4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol is a derivative of cholestanol, which has a melting point around 148-150°C. The presence of the epoxide group (C-O-C) in the 8,9-position can increase the melting point due to the additional rigidity and potential for hydrogen bonding. However, the presence of the hydroxyl group (-OH) in the 3-position can decrease the melting point due to the potential for increased hydrogen bonding. The net effect of these modifications is a slight increase in the melting point due to the epoxide group's rigidity and potential for hydrogen bonding, which is slightly reduced by the presence of the hydroxyl group.
